name: Kesar Lassi
history: Kesar Lassi is a variant of the traditional Indian yogurt-based drink, lassi, enhanced with the luxurious addition of saffron (kesar). Originating from Punjab, lassi is a popular, cooling beverage enjoyed throughout India and has various flavors.
description: Kesar Lassi is a creamy, rich yogurt drink flavored with saffron and cardamom. It's often sweetened with sugar and garnished with chopped nuts. This lassi is known for its aromatic flavor and is a refreshing treat, especially during hot weather.

instructions.title: Soak Saffron
instructions.description: Soak saffron strands in 2 tablespoons of warm milk for about 10 minutes to release their color and aroma.

instructions.title: Blend Ingredients
instructions.description: In a blender, combine yogurt, the remaining milk, sugar, the saffron-infused milk, and cardamom powder. Blend until smooth and creamy.

instructions.title: Serve Chilled
instructions.description: Pour the lassi into glasses. Add ice cubes if desired. Garnish with chopped nuts.

tips: Adjust the amount of sugar according to your taste.
For a vegan version, use plant-based yogurt and milk.
variations: Add rose water for a floral twist.
Blend with fresh fruits like mango for a fruity variation.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for a few hours.
storage.instructions: Store in the refrigerator and stir well before serving.

presentationTips: Serve in traditional Indian glassware or tall glasses.
Garnish with a saffron strand or a sprinkle of cardamom powder for an elegant touch.
